00001 ## @package perlin_noise
00002 ## @brief Contains the algorithms for producing perlin noise.
00003 
00004 from __future__ import division
00005 from __future__ import with_statement
00006 
00007 from random import random
00008 from random import shuffle
00009 from random import randint
00010 from math import floor
00011 from math import cos

00015 from enhanced_grid import Grid2D

00018 ##Generates a Grid with uniform noise, generated 
00019 ##between 0 and 1.
00020 ##
00021 #       @param width
00022 #               The width of the Grid to produce.
00023 #               @param height
00024 #               The height of the Grid to produce.
00025 def make_uniform_noise(width, height):
00026         noise = Grid2D((width, height), 0)
00027         
00028         for p in noise.index_iter():
00029                 noise[p] = random() #randint(0, 1) #random()
00030 
00031         return noise
00032         
00033 def make_checker_board_noise(width, height, period=1):
00034         noise = Grid2D((width, height), 0)
00035         
00036         for p in noise.index_iter():
00037                 i, j = p
00038                 noise[p] = (i // period % 2 + j // period % 2) % 2
00039                 
00040         return noise
00041 
00042 ##@brief Class for generating smooth noise.
00043 ##
00044 # Successive calls to generate will use the same underlying grid
00045 # of uniform noise to sample from.
00046 class SmoothNoise:
00047         
00048         ## Constructs a new SmoothNoise object
00049         # @param width
00050         #               Width of the grid to generate
00051         # @param height
00052         #               Height of the grid to generate
00053         # @param noise_fn
00054         #               A function that takes two arguments (the grid dimensions) and return a grid of noise
00055         # @param interpolation
00056         #               A string that specifies what interpolation scheme to use. Can be 'linear', 'cosine', or 'cubic'.
00057         def __init__(self, width, height, noise_fn = make_uniform_noise, interpolation='linear'):
00058                 self.nois_fn = noise_fn
00059                 self.uniform_noise = noise_fn(width, height)
00060                 
00061                 self.width = width
00062                 self.height = height
00063                 
00064                 if interpolation == 'linear':
00065                         self.interpolation = self.linear_interpolation  
00066                 elif interpolation == 'cosine':
00067                         self.interpolation = self.cosine_interpolation  
00068                 elif interpolation == 'cubic':
00069                         self.interpolation == self.cubic_interpolation
00070                 else:
00071                         self.interpolation = self.linear_interpolation
00072         
00073         ##Generates a grid with the smooth noise
00074         ##
00075         # @param k
00076         #               The sampling distance, usually a power of 2.
00077         #               If k == 1, every point in the uniform noise grid is sampled
00078         #               and the returned grid is equivalent to the uniform noise
00079         #               grid.
00080         def generate(self, k):
00081                 return self.linear_interpolation(k)
00082         
00083         def linear_interpolation(self, k):
00084                 t = 2**k
00085                 noise = self.uniform_noise
00086                 smooth_noise = Grid2D((self.width, self.height), 0)
00087                 
00088                 for i in range(self.width):     
00089                         x0, x1, x_alpha = sample_points(i, t, self.width)
00090                         
00091                         for j in range(self.height):                            
00092                                 y0, y1, y_alpha = sample_points(j, t, self.height)
00093                                 
00094                                 a0 = (1 - x_alpha)*noise[x0, y0] +(x_alpha)*noise[x1, y0]
00095                                 a1 = (1 - x_alpha)*noise[x0, y1] + (x_alpha)*noise[x1, y1]
00096                                 
00097                                 smooth_noise[i, j] = (1 - y_alpha)*a0 + (y_alpha)*a1
00098                 return smooth_noise
00099 
00100         def cosine_interpolation(self, k):
00101                 t = 2**k
00102                 noise = self.uniform_noise
00103                 smooth_noise = Grid2D((self.width, self.height), 0)
00104                 
00105                 for i in range(self.width):     
00106                         x0, x1, x_alpha = sample_points(i, t, self.width)
00107                         x_alpha = (1-cos(x_alpha*pi))/2
00108                         for j in range(self.height):                            
00109                                 y0, y1, y_alpha = sample_points(j, t, self.height)
00110                                 y_alpha = (1-cos(y_alpha*pi))/2
00111                                 
00112                                 a0 = (1 - x_alpha)*noise[x0, y0] +(x_alpha)*noise[x1, y0]
00113                                 a1 = (1 - x_alpha)*noise[x0, y1] + (x_alpha)*noise[x1, y1]
00114                                 
00115                                 smooth_noise[i, j] = (1 - y_alpha)*a0 + (y_alpha)*a1
00116                 return smooth_noise
00117 
00118         def cubic_interpolation(self, k):
00119                 t = 2**k
00120                 noise = self.uniform_noise
00121                 smooth_noise = Grid2D((self.width, self.height), 0)
00122                 
00123                 for i in range(self.width):     
00124                         x0, x1, x2, x3, x_alpha, x_alpha_2, x_alpha_3, x_alpha_i, x_alpha_i2, x_alpha_i3 = sample_points_cubic(i, t, self.width)
00125                         
00126                         for j in range(self.height):                            
00127                                 y0, y1, y2, y3, y_alpha, y_alpha_2, y_alpha_3, y_alpha_i, y_alpha_i2, y_alpha_i3 = sample_points_cubic(j, t, self.height)
00128                         
00129                                 a0 = x_alpha_i3*noise[x0, y0] + x_alpha_i2*x_alpha*noise[x1, y0] + \
00130                                          x_alpha_i*x_alpha_2*noise[x2, y0] + x_alpha_3*noise[x3, y0]
00131                                 a1 = x_alpha_i3*noise[x0, y1] + x_alpha_i2*x_alpha*noise[x1, y1] + \
00132                                          x_alpha_i*x_alpha_2*noise[x2, y1] + x_alpha_3*noise[x3, y1]
00133                                 a2 = x_alpha_i3*noise[x0, y2] + x_alpha_i2*x_alpha*noise[x1, y2] + \
00134                                          x_alpha_i*x_alpha_2*noise[x2, y2] + x_alpha_3*noise[x3, y2]
00135                                 a3 = x_alpha_i3*noise[x0, y3] + x_alpha_i2*x_alpha*noise[x1, y3] + \
00136                                          x_alpha_i*x_alpha_2*noise[x2, y3] + x_alpha_3*noise[x3, y3]
00137                                 
00138                                 smooth_noise[i, j] = y_alpha_i3*a0 + y_alpha_i2*y_alpha*a1 + \
00139                                          y_alpha_i*y_alpha_2*a2 + y_alpha_3*a3
00140                 return smooth_noise             
00141 
00142 ##@brief Private.
00143 ##
00144 # @param noise
00145 #               A noise grid from which the first row and first column will be copied.
00146 def perlin_noise_from_smoothnoise(width, height, layers, falloff, noise, normalize=True):
00147         perlin_noise = Grid2D((width, height), 0)       
00148         r = 1
00149         
00150         for k in range(layers):
00151                 r *= falloff
00152                 s_noise = noise.generate(layers - k - 1)
00153 
00154                 for p in perlin_noise.index_iter():
00155                         perlin_noise[p] += s_noise[p]*r
00156 
00157         #Normalise
00158         if normalize:
00159                 r = 1
00160                 w = 0
00161                 
00162                 for k in range(layers):
00163                         r *= falloff
00164                         w += r
00165                 
00166                 for p in perlin_noise.index_iter():
00167                         perlin_noise[p] /= w
00168                         
00169         return perlin_noise
00170 
00171 ##@brief Generates Perlin noise in a rectangle.
00172 ##
00173 # @param width
00174 #               The width of the rectangle.
00175 # @param height
00176 #               The height of the rectangle
00177 # @param layers
00178 #               The number of layers of smooth noise to use.
00179 # @param tiles
00180 #               The number of tiles to generate. These tiles will all 
00181 #               tile with themselves and each other.
00182 def perlin_noise(width, height, layers, falloff = 0.5, tiles=1):
00183         noise = SmoothNoise(width, height)
00184         p = [perlin_noise_from_smoothnoise(width, height, layers, falloff, noise)]
00185         
00186         for k in range(tiles - 1):
00187                 noise = SmoothNoise(width, height)
00188                 p.append(perlin_noise_from_smoothnoise(width, height, layers, falloff, noise))
00189                 
00190         return p
00191         
00192 ##@brief Generates integer Perlin noise in a rectangle.
00193 ##
00194 # @param width
00195 #               The width of the rectangle.
00196 # @param height
00197 #               The height of the rectangle
00198 # @param layers
00199 #               The number of layers of smooth noise to use.
00200 # @param n
00201 #               The integer range for the resulting noise. If n is 7, for
00202 #               example, all values in the grid will be 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6.
00203 # @param tiles
00204 #               The number of tiles to generate. These tiles will all 
00205 #               tile with themselves and each other.
00206 def int_perlin_noise(width, height, layers, n, tiles=1):
00207         noise_list = perlin_noise(width, height, layers)
00208         int_noise_list = []
00209         
00210         for noise in noise_list:
00211                 int_noise = Grid2D(width, height)
00212                 
00213                 for p in index_iter(int_noise):
00214                         int_noise[p] = int(floor(noise[p]/(1 / n)))
00215                 
00216                 int_noise_list.append(int_noise)
00217                         
00218         return int_noise_list
00219 
00220 ##@brief Returns a shuffled list of integers in the range 0 to n - 1.
00221 def random_permutation(n):
00222         return shuffle(range(n))        
00223 
00224 ##@brief Private.
00225 # Returns a tuple that can be used for cubic interpolation
00226 # the tuple is the tuple x0, x1, x2, x3, alpha
00227 # such that 
00228 # @code
00229 # x0 = x // t * t
00230 # x1 = x0 + t
00231 # x = alpha * t + x0
00232 # x = x1 - (1 - alpha) * t
00233 # x0 <= x <x1
00234 # @endcode
00235 def sample_points(x, t, max_x):
00236         x0 = x // t * t
00237         return x0, (x0 + t) % max_x, (x - x0) / t
00238 
00239 def sample_points_cubic(x, t, max_x):
00240         x1 = x // t * t
00241         x0 = (x1 - t) % max_x
00242         x2 = (x1 + t) % max_x
00243         x3 = (x1 + 2*t) % max_x
00244         x_alpha = 1 - (x - x1) / t 
00245         
00246         x_alpha_2 = x_alpha * x_alpha
00247         x_alpha_3 = x_alpha * x_alpha_2
00248 
00249         x_alpha_i = 1 - x_alpha
00250         x_alpha_i2 = x_alpha_i*x_alpha_i
00251         x_alpha_i3 = x_alpha_i2 * x_alpha_i
00252         
00253         return x0, x1, x2, x3, x_alpha, x_alpha_2, x_alpha_3, x_alpha_i, x_alpha_i2, x_alpha_i3
00254         
00255 
00256 def uniform_noise_3d(width, height, depth):
00257         noise = Grid3D((width, height, depth), 0)
00258         
00259         for p in noise.index_iter():
00260                 noise[p] = random()
00261                                         
00262         return noise
00263

00265 ##@brief Class for generating smooth noise.
00266 ##
00267 # Successive calls to generate will use the same underlying grid
00268 # of uniform noise to sample from.
00269 class SmoothNoise3D:
00270         
00271         ## Constructs a new SmoothNoise object
00272         # @param oldNoise
00273         #               If oldNoise is given, the first row and column of oldNoise's
00274         #               uniform noise grid is copied to this SmoothNoise object's
00275         #               uniform noise grid. This is for making sets of tiles with certain 
00276         #               algorithms, such as the Perlin noise algorithm.
00277         def __init__(self, width, height, depth):
00278                 self.uniform_noise = uniform_noise_3d(width, height, depth)
00279                 
00280                 self.width = width
00281                 self.height = height
00282                 self.depth = depth
00283                 
00284         ##Generates a grid with the smooth noise
00285         ##
00286         # @param k
00287         #               The sampling distance, usually a power of 2.
00288         #               If k == 1, every point in the uniform noise grid is sampled
00289         #               and the returned grid is equivalent to the uniform noise
00290         #               grid.
00291         def generate(self, k):                  
00292                 t = 2**k
00293                 noise = self.uniform_noise
00294                 smooth_noise = Grid3D((self.width, self.height, self.depth), 0)
00295         
00296                 for i in range(self.width):
00297                         x0, x1, x_alpha = sample_points(i, t, self.width)
00298                         
00299                         for j in range(self.height):
00300                                 y0, y1, y_alpha = sample_points(j, t, self.height)
00301                                 
00302                                 for k in range(self.depth):
00303                                         z0, z1, z_alpha = sample_points(k, t, self.depth)
00304                                                                                 
00305                                         a0 = (1 - x_alpha)*noise[x0, y0, z0] + x_alpha*noise[x1, y0, z0]
00306                                         a1 = (1 - x_alpha)*noise[x0, y1, z0] + x_alpha*noise[x1, y1, z0]
00307                                         c0 = (1 - y_alpha)*a0 + y_alpha*a1
00308                                         
00309                                         b0 = (1 - x_alpha)*noise[x0, y0, z1] + x_alpha*noise[x1, y0, z1]
00310                                         b1 = (1 - x_alpha)*noise[x0, y1, z1] + x_alpha*noise[x1, y1, z1]
00311                                         c1 = (1 - y_alpha)*b0 + y_alpha*b1
00312                 
00313                                         smooth_noise[i, j, k] = (1 - z_alpha)*c0 + z_alpha*c1
00314 
00315                 return smooth_noise
00316 
00317 ##@brief Private.
00318 ##
00319 def perlin_noise_from_smoothnoise_3d(width, height, depth, layers, falloff):
00320         perlin_noise = Grid3D((width, height, depth), 0)
00321         noise = SmoothNoise3D(width, height, depth)
00322         r = 1
00323         
00324         for kk in range(layers):
00325                 r *= falloff
00326                 s_noise = noise.generate(layers - kk - 1)
00327                 
00328                 for p in perlin_noise.index_iter():
00329                         perlin_noise[p] += s_noise[p]*r
00330 
00331         r = 1
00332         w = 0
00333         
00334         for kk in range(layers):
00335                 r *= falloff
00336                 w += r
00337         
00338         for p in perlin_noise.index_iter():
00339                 perlin_noise[p] /= w
00340                 
00341         return perlin_noise

00343 ##@brief Generates integer Perlin noise in a 3D box.
00344 ##
00345 # @param width
00346 #               The width of the box.
00347 # @param height
00348 #               The height of the box
00349 # @param depth
00350 #               The depth of the box
00351 # @param layers
00352 #               The number of layers of smooth noise to use.
00353 # @param n
00354 #               The integer range for the resulting noise. If n is 7, for
00355 #               example, all values in the grid will be 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6.
00356 # @param tiles
00357 #               The number of tiles to generate. These tiles will all 
00358 #               tile with themselves and each other.
00359 def perlin_noise_3d(width, height, depth, layers, falloff = 0.5, tiles=1):
00360         p = [perlin_noise_from_smoothnoise_3d(width, height, depth, layers, falloff)]
00361                         
00362         return p
